analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Blessed One, the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One, so I have heard:

original: “Mohaṁ, bhikkhave, anabhijānaṁ aparijānaṁ tattha cittaṁ avirājayaṁ appajahaṁ abhabbo dukkhakkhayāya.
analyzed: bhikkhave an abhijānam a parijānam tattha cittam a virājayam a pajaham abhabbaḥ dukkha kkhayāya
translated: “Monks, without directly knowing and fully understanding delusion, without making it fade away and giving it up, one is unable to make an end of suffering.

original: Mohañca kho, bhikkhave, abhijānaṁ parijānaṁ tattha cittaṁ virājayaṁ pajahaṁ bhabbo dukkhakkhayāyā”ti.🔽Etamatthaṁ bhagavā avoca.
analyzed: moham ca kho bhikkhave abhijānam parijānam tattha cittam virājayam pajaham bhabbaḥ dukkha kkhayāya ati  etam attham bhagavān avoca
translated: But by directly knowing and fully understanding delusion, by making it fade away and giving it up, one is able to make an end of suffering.”🔽The Blessed One said this.

analyzed: tattha itam iti vuccati  yena mohena mūḍhāse
translated: And in connection with this, it was said:🔽“Delusion by which beings go
Having given it up, they do not return

original: imaṁ lokaṁ kudācanan”ti.🔽Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: imam lokam kudācananti  ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti

translated: This, too, was the meaning of what was said by the Blessed One, so I have heard.🔽The first section is finished.
